rccs.description: Create React Class Component with state

con.description: The constructor for a React component is called before it is mounted.

cwm.description: componentWillMount() is invoked immediately before mounting occurs.

cdm.description: componentDidMount() is invoked immediately after a component is mounted.

cwrp.description: componentWillReccomponentWillReceiveProps() is invoked before a mounted component receives new props.

scu.description: Use shouldComponentUpdate() to let React know if a componentâ€™s output is not affected by the current change in state or props.

cwu.description: componentWillUpdate() is invoked immediately before rendering when new props or state are being received.

cdu.description: componentDidUpdate() is invoked immediately after updating occurs.

cwun.description: componentWillUnmount() is invoked immediately before a component is unmounted and destroyed.

cdc.description: Error boundaries are React components that catch JavaScript errors anywhere in their child component tree.

ss.description: setState() enqueues changes to the component state and tells React that this component and its children need to be re-rendered with the updated state.

ssf.description: When next state depends on the previous state.
